1.text: My son, keep my words. Lay up my commandments within you.

2.text: Keep my commandments and live! Guard my teaching as the apple of your eye.

3.text: Bind them on your fingers. Write them on the tablet of your heart.

4.text: Tell wisdom, “You are my sister.” Call understanding your relative,

5.text: that they may keep you from the strange woman, from the foreigner who flatters with her words.

6.text: For at the window of my house, I looked out through my lattice.

7.text: I saw among the simple ones. I discerned among the youths a young man void of understanding,

8.text: passing through the street near her corner, he went the way to her house,

9.text: in the twilight, in the evening of the day, in the middle of the night and in the darkness.

10.text: Behold, there a woman met him with the attire of a prostitute, and with crafty intent.

11.text: She is loud and defiant. Her feet don’t stay in her house.

12.text: Now she is in the streets, now in the squares, and lurking at every corner.

13.text: So she caught him, and kissed him. With an impudent face she said to him:

14.text: “Sacrifices of peace offerings are with me. This day I have paid my vows.

15.text: Therefore I came out to meet you, to diligently seek your face, and I have found you.

16.text: I have spread my couch with carpets of tapestry, with striped cloths of the yarn of Egypt.

17.text: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

18.text: Come, let’s take our fill of loving until the morning. Let’s solace ourselves with loving.

19.text: For my husband isn’t at home. He has gone on a long journey.

20.text: He has taken a bag of money with him. He will come home at the full moon.”

21.text: With persuasive words, she led him astray. With the flattering of her lips, she seduced him.

22.text: He followed her immediately, as an ox goes to the slaughter, as a fool stepping into a noose.

23.text: Until an arrow strikes through his liver, as a bird hurries to the snare, and doesn’t know that it will cost his life.

24.text: Now therefore, sons, listen to me. Pay attention to the words of my mouth.

25.text: Don’t let your heart turn to her ways. Don’t go astray in her paths,

26.text: for she has thrown down many wounded. Yes, all her slain are a mighty army.

27.text: Her house is the way to Sheol, going down to the rooms of death.
